io.github.samwright.framework.model

Class SplitJoinWorkflowContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.samwright.framework.model.AbstractProcessor
      • io.github.samwright.framework.model.AbstractElement
        • io.github.samwright.framework.model.AbstractWorkflowContainer
          • io.github.samwright.framework.model.SplitJoinWorkflowContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChildOf<Workflow>, Controllable, Deletable, EventuallyImmutable, ParentOf<Workflow>, Replaceable, Validatable, Versioned, XMLSerialisable, Element, Processor, WorkflowContainer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HandDetector, SkinDetector

    public abstract class SplitJoinWorkflowContainer
extends AbstractWorkflowContainer
    A WorkflowContainer that allows for all of its Workflow objects to concurrently process input data, before finally joining them together back into a single Mediator output.

      • processTrainingData

        public List<Mediator> processTrainingData(Mediator input)
        Description copied from interface: Processor
        Given a Mediator object containing training data, produce all output Mediator objects that this Processor could possibly produce. The input data will be for training, and if this Processor expects to be notified of prior Processor objects' completions, it will be notified by the notify(List<Mediator<?>>) method, which contains all training data.

        For elemental Processors, this means applying process(input) on each input, and for Processors comprising multiple Workflow objects this means processing each input using all appropriate Workflows.

        Specified by:
        processTrainingData in interface Processor
        Overrides:
        processTrainingData in class AbstractProcessor
        Parameters:
        input - set of Mediator objects containing input data.
        Returns:
        all output Mediators that this could possibly produce, indexed by each input mediator that created them.

      • joinOutputMediators

        public abstract Object joinOutputMediators(List<Mediator> mediators)
        Joins the data in the supplied mediators into one output data (to be used in the final output mediator). The supplied mediators are the outputs of the child workflows (in the same order as the workflows appear in this.getChildren().
        Parameters:
        mediators - the list of mediators whose data should be joined.
        Returns:
        the single output object that results from joining the supplied data.

      • processCompletedTrainingBatch

        public CompletedTrainingBatch processCompletedTrainingBatch(CompletedTrainingBatch completedTrainingBatch)
        Description copied from interface: Processor
        This method is called after a training batch has been processed to completion, and returns a rolled-back version of the supplied CompletedTrainingBatch.

        The supplied completedTrainingBatch object contains the Mediator objects returned from the last call to processTrainingBatch(..), and which of those went on to be successful.

        "Rolling-back" means reverting these output Mediator<O> objects to input Mediator<I> objects, and correctly marking which of those went on to be successful.

        Processor objects containing multiple ways of processing the same input will have created multiple outputs per input, in which case this method must choose which output would have been created had the input been given to process(input). Only if this output was successful will its corresponding input mediator will be marked as successful.

        If this Processor needs training or optimising, this is the method to do it.

        If this Processor intends to train a classifier to be used in {Code process(input)} to select the best strategy for each individual input data, it is advisable to create a classifier for each input Mediator object's History object. This means that data that is created differently is classified differently.

        One approach would be to use a Map<History, Classifier> object that is queried in the process(input) method to get the appropriate Classifier for the given input.getHistory() object.

        It is left to the concrete class to decide whether to do this or not (eg. the training set per classifier would be larger by not doing this).

        Specified by:
        processCompletedTrainingBatch in interface Processor
        Overrides:
        processCompletedTrainingBatch in class AbstractProcessor
        Parameters:
        completedTrainingBatch - the completed training batch, containing the Mediator objects returned from the last call to processTrainingBatch(..), and which of those went on to be successful.
        Returns:
        the rolled-back CompletedTrainingBatch.
